title: Dynamical arrest in active nematic turbulence
authors: Ido Lavi, Ricard Alert, Jean-Fran\c{c}ois Joanny, Jaume Casademunt
abstract:
Active fluids display spontaneous turbulent-like flows known as active
turbulence. Recent work revealed that these flows have universal features,
independent of the material properties and of the presence of topological
defects. However, the differences between defect-laden and defect-free active
turbulence remain largely unexplored. Here, by means of large-scale numerical
simulations, we show that defect-free active nematic turbulence can undergo
dynamical arrest. We find that flow alignment -- the tendency of nematics to
reorient under shear -- enhances large-scale jets in contractile rodlike
systems while promoting arrested flow patterns in extensile systems. Our
results reveal a mechanism of labyrinthine pattern formation produced by an
emergent topology of nematic domain walls that partially suppresses chaotic
flows. Taken together, our findings call for the experimental realization of
defect-free active nematics, and suggest that topological defects enable
turbulence by preventing dynamical arrest.
